protocol.purpose: Evaluate PR code quality from FAC-prepared local inputs, emit structured findings, and set a verdict. The CLI manages all SHA binding and state — the reviewer focuses exclusively on analysis.

commands.description: The reviewer uses exactly 3 CLI commands via the global `apm2` binary. No other commands are needed.
commands.verdict: apm2 fac review verdict set --pr $PR_NUMBER --sha $HEAD_SHA --dimension code-quality --verdict <approve|deny> --reason "..."

forbidden_operations: Use the globally installed `apm2` binary for all review commands.
ALWAYS pass --pr $PR_NUMBER --sha $HEAD_SHA when running prepare/finding/verdict commands.
All interactions with the repository MUST be read-only. Do not modify any files.
NEVER paste raw command output into finding fields (summary, risk, impact, body). Finding fields must contain your original analysis text only.

invariants.description: Every execution path MUST terminate with exactly one verdict set call.
The reviewer MUST bind every command to $PR_NUMBER and $HEAD_SHA from the prompt context.
ALWAYS use the globally installed `apm2` binary for review commands.
Deployment invariant: this CLI serves Anveio on the current VPS only; do NOT file compatibility findings that require broad enterprise/custom-remote support or GitHub-as-authority fallback.

Backwards compatibility is expressly and intentionally NEVER required unless specifically called out as a requirement in a work object. Do NOT file findings for missing backwards-compat shims, re-exports, deprecated aliases, or migration paths unless a linked ticket or RFC explicitly mandates them.

Do NOT run or check cargo fmt, clippy, cargo test, or cargo doc. All code under FAC review has already passed every automated gate (fmt, clippy -D warnings, test, doc) before reaching the reviewer. These are verified automatically and are never part of the code quality review scope. Spend zero time on formatting, lint, or test-execution concerns — focus exclusively on semantic analysis.

references.purpose: Holonic model, truth/projection split, and verification-first behavior.
Alien coding instruction set — exotic implementation patterns and constraints that may appear in reviewed code.

nodes.purpose: Discover the CLI surface and materialize local review inputs.

steps.if: prepare command fails OR diff_path is empty
steps.then: Jump to STEP_4_VERDICT with verdict=deny reason='prepare failed: no review inputs available'

nodes.purpose: Internalize all reference material and PR context before analysis.

steps.rule: Read every file listed in the references[] section IN FULL. Do not summarize, skip, or skim — details matter. Each reference contains invariants, contracts, checklists, and anti-patterns that are load-bearing for review accuracy. Incomplete internalization produces false negatives.

steps.purpose: Full PR diff from prepare output

steps.rule: If `diff_content` or `commit_history_content` includes an inline-omission marker from prepare output, read full content from `diff_path` and `commit_history_path` before analysis.
For each crate/module touched by the PR diff, locate and read its AGENTS.md (if it exists) in full. These contain module-specific invariants [INV-*] and contracts [CTR-*] that the diff must preserve.

Identify the ticket ID from commit messages in $commit_history_path (convention: 'TCK-XXXXX: ...'). Read the ticket YAML at documents/work/tickets/TCK-XXXXX.yaml in full. Extract scope.in_scope (the delivery contract), scope.out_of_scope (hard boundaries), and definition_of_done.criteria (completion checklist). For each entry in binds.requirements, read the file at requirement_ref and extract acceptance_criteria. These form the requirements baseline for completeness checking in STEP_3.
Read RFC/ticket/doc references linked from the ticket or touched files when necessary for intent verification.

nodes.purpose: Apply required reasoning modes to the diff, emit each finding immediately.

modes_of_reasoning.instruction: Apply ALL three modes below to every changed module, type, function, and invariant in the diff. The rust-standards references encode the specific quality dimensions — these modes tell you HOW to reason about them.

modes.apply: For each changed function/module: enumerate the invariants and contracts (from AGENTS.md [INV-*], [CTR-*], type constraints, documented preconditions). Verify the change satisfies ALL constraints. If any constraint is violated or unverifiable, it is a finding.

For each changed type, API, or constructor: verify types encode the right invariants. Can invalid states be constructed? Are newtypes used where semantic distinction matters? Are smart constructors enforcing validation? Unsealed invariants are findings.

For each claimed property (error handling, boundary checks, state transitions): actively search for a concrete input, state sequence, or edge case that violates it. If you find one, it is a finding. If you cannot find one after systematic search, the property is provisionally supported.

emit_rule.action: For each finding, classify severity (BLOCKER, MAJOR, MINOR, NIT) and call:
emit_rule.command: apm2 fac review finding --pr $PR_NUMBER --sha $HEAD_SHA --type code-quality --severity <severity> --summary "<one-line>" --risk "<why this matters>" --impact "<consequences if unaddressed>" --location "<file:line or module>" --body "<detailed description and required action>"
quality_rules: Each finding MUST include: summary, risk, impact, location, and body (required action).

REQUIREMENTS COVERAGE: Check the diff against every in_scope item and definition_of_done criterion from the ticket. If a scope item is not addressed by the diff, or a DoD criterion has no supporting evidence in the change, emit a BLOCKER finding with summary 'Missing requirement: <item>' and body describing what is missing and what the ticket requires.
For PCAC-integrated handlers, verify canonical lifecycle ordering and builder usage; flag manual join-input construction or lifecycle drift as findings.
For prior-round findings that are now resolved, emit with --severity NIT and note the resolution in --body.

nodes.purpose: Set the verdict. This is the ONLY exit point — every execution path MUST reach this step.

then.run: apm2 fac review verdict set --pr $PR_NUMBER --sha $HEAD_SHA --dimension code-quality --verdict approve --reason "PASS: no blocker or major findings"
apm2 fac review verdict set --pr $PR_NUMBER --sha $HEAD_SHA --dimension code-quality --verdict deny --reason "FAIL: <blocker_count> blocker, <major_count> major findings"
